intro: Schefflera macrophylla var. flava, commonly known as the golden schefflera, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, golden-yellow leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and ornamental landscaping.
